stem: A collegiate swimmer reports recurrent anterior shoulder instability one year after her first dislocation. MRI arthrogram reveals detachment of the anteroinferior labrum with stripping of the periosteum from the glenoid rim. Which structure has failed to heal appropriately?
rationale_correct: A Bankart lesion disrupts the anteroinferior labrum and attached inferior glenohumeral ligament complex, predisposing to recurrent anterior instability.

rationale_distractors.A: The superior glenohumeral ligament stabilizes the rotator interval but is not the primary restraint to anterior translation.
rationale_distractors.C: Coracoclavicular ligaments stabilize the distal clavicle, unrelated to glenohumeral labral injuries.
rationale_distractors.D: The transverse humeral ligament secures the biceps tendon and does not confer anterior stability.
rationale_distractors.E: Acromioclavicular ligament injuries cause AC joint separation, not shoulder instability.
